channel.title: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?
channel.description:
I still have my Amiga 1200 in a box in my house with mouse and monitor. Haven't powered it up in years, but I can't bring myself up to get rid of it.
Has anyone else had an attachment to something like this? Is this crazy or what?

item.title: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
CPU:

I was more attached to this than probably anything else I’ve ever owned.

'68 Goldtop Les Paul

;_;7

Read full topic

item.title: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Dr. Karamazov:

I was very attached to my slaves. One of them had a damn sweet ass.
I sure was sad to lose them.

Lol, I literally had just thought to make that joke clicked on this thread and saw that you just made it.

item.dc:creator: amazingcomedy
item.description:
N64 from my child days. I still play it from time to time, and I do my best to make sure it runs well. It’s still in pretty good condition.

item.source: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?

item.title: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?
item.dc:creator: Veritas
item.description:
Running shoes.

Good ones are hard to find, and once you get a nice pair and you’ve broken them in; nothing beats it. I had a pair of Nike’s that felt like heaven, and my mother thought they looked raggedy so she threw them away. Never had a better pair of shoes in my life.

EDIT: And also running shorts, those are truly the shit, and I still have a few pair from freshman year of high school.

Read full topic
item.source: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?

CPU:

I was more attached to this than probably anything else I’ve ever owned.

'68 Goldtop Les Paul

That’s a real beauty right there, man.

Read full topic
item.source: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?

item.title: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?
item.dc:creator: Fnork
item.description:
I do this with pretty much everything I own, especially things that have been given to me.

More than anything I’d say I hold my alarm clock, my bed lamp, my potted ivy, my collection of hats, and my tea mugs in especially high regard.

Beyond that I have piles of old shirts, underwear and random trinkets in my old house just lying about never to be even seen.

Read full topic
item.source: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?

item.title: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
I still can’t believe I sold my DS. I really wish I had it back, because there were some fun games for it that I had. That said, I do like the PSP I have now- Persona 3 on the go =D

Read full topic

So far I’ve got a Motorola Droid 2 global, Moto Atrix 4G, HTC G1, HTC Inc2, Acer Liquid E, LG Optimus P500 and ZTE N762 (Public Mobile)

item.dc:creator: CPU
item.description:
Capt Quark:

I still have my Amiga 1200 in a box in my house with mouse and monitor. Haven’t powered it up in years, but I can’t bring myself up to get rid of it.

Has anyone else had an attachment to something like this? Is this crazy or what?

I was more attached to this than probably anything else I’ve ever owned.

'68 Goldtop Les Paul

Read full topic
item.source: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?

item.title: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
I suppose I might be attached to a few things that have special meaning to me, but mostly I just have what Tolkien described as ‘mathoms’ - things for which I have no immediate use but that I am unwilling to just throw away. I mean, I could still make some money out of those car parts that have been sitting in the garage for years, and who knows when I might need this old firewire card?!

Also, I’ve accumulated a lot of e-waste that I don’t want to just throw in the garbage, but I’ve been too lazy too bother taking it to a recycler.

Read full topic

item.title: Ever had an attachment to something you owned?

item.description:
FERGUS:

one pair of nice ass shoes


:retard:

I collect old hard drives…I have about 10 sitting in a box. Haven’t powered them up in years and I don’t even remember if I’ve ever removed any data from them.
